bib.title: Neutron Capture Cross Sections Of Cr,Mn,Ni,Nb,Ag,In,Sband Au In The 8 To 120 Kev Region

Full description, graphs

BIB section updated
Corrections have been made for multiple scattering and
self-screening.
Moxon RAE detectors with plastic scintillator
No details given
Pulsed Van de Graaff 3MeV at Pelindaba
5.5MeV at SUNI.
Neutron energy was calculated from the proton
energy, assuming a value of -1.6433 MeV for the
Li-7(p,n)Be-7 reaction Q-value, or determined from
the time-of-flight measurement.
Time-of-flight used to eliminate background
gammas and in some cases to measure neutron energy.
Metal disks of either 2.5 cm or 5.1 cm diam.
Data correspond to Fig 5 -7 of Nucl. Phys.,
Corrected for detector efficiency (ratio In/Ni eff.
assumed  0.820). No correction for self-shielding or
multiscattering.
Lithium target thickness 25 keV. Neutron energy
selected with time-of-flight.Proton energy 1.891 MeV
Basically normalized to value of Gibbons et
al,Phys.Rev.122,182(1961) at 30 keV,which was based on
averaged weighted standard (Ag,Sb,In,Au,I) from the
absolute meas. by Schmitt and Cook,Nucl.Phys.20,202
(1960) at 24 keV.  Indium capture assumed to follow
the function  1820 - 39.1*E  for E between 7 and 18 keV
and  44000/(sqrt(E)*(1+4*E**0.25)) for E between 18 and
120 keV (units mb and keV). Monitoring by proton charge
deposited on target and by long counter
Metal,6.7, 13.4 and 26.8 atoms/mb.  Data averaged over
the three runs in geometry III.
data from Brooks as a private commun. Sept 1969

on the data in subentry 8 and with the following
assumptions=

average level spacing=     24 eV
S-wave strength function=  1.0E-4

Area analysis modified to give average width,
assuming average level spacing 10.4keV for Cr-52 and
2.8 For Cr-53. Energy range chosen to minimize
contributions from distant levels
From Table 3 in ref
Area analysis modified to give average width,
assuming average level spacing 2.9 keV. Energy range
chosen to minimize contributions from distant levels
From Table 3 in ref
Area analysis modified to give average widths,
assuming average level spacing 1.1 keV for Ni-58 and
0.7 keV for Ni-60 below 20 keV, 3.9 keV for Ni-58 and
3.5 keV for Ni-60 above 20 keV. Energy ranges chosen to
minimize contributions from distant levels
